intro: Achilleanthus novobrittaniensis, commonly known as the New Britain achilleanthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Britain in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
